intro: Hibbertia nymphaea, commonly known as the fairy bells, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Hibbertia nymphaea produces small, green, egg-shaped fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting native wildlife.
